description: The Department of National Defence has a requirement for the items detailed below.
full_summary:
### Notice of Proposed Procurement: Net, Cargo Aerial Delivery

**Tender Reference:** PW-22-01004123; Solicitation Number: W8485-237240/A
**Publication Date:** August 12, 2022; Closing Date: September 13, 2022, 14:00 EST

The Department of National Defence is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the procurement of net, cargo aerial delivery systems. This procurement aims to acquire three types of cargo nets assembled to specified standards.

**Summary of Requirements:**

*   Item 1: Cargo Net Assy, Part No. R-222, NCAGE 64953 (Miller Safety Ltd) - Quantity: 30, Unit of Issue: EA
*   Item 2: Net, Cargo Aerial Delivery, Part No. HU10-0103601, NCAGE K2429 (AMSafe Bridgeport) - Quantity: 20, Unit of Issue: EA
*   Item 3: Net, Cargo, Aerial Delivery, Part No. HU10-0094920, NCAGE K2429 (AMSafe Bridgeport) - Quantity: 16, Unit of Issue: EA

**Delivery Requirements:**

*   Deliveries are to take place at CAAWC Trenton, Canada by November 15th, 2022
*   Bidders proposing an equivalent or substitute product must provide brand name and model or part number and NCAGE

**Bid Submission:**

*   Due to COVID-19 pandemic impacts, bidders are strongly encouraged to submit their bids electronically using the epost Connect service
*   Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada

**Trade Agreements:**

*   This procurement is subject to the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

### Contact Information

*   Danny Lebel, Contracting Authority
*   dany.lebel2@forces.gc.ca
*   Phone: None
*   Fax: None
*   Postal Code: None
*   Country: None

Note that this announcement is a request for proposal and interested bidders should review the bid solicitation document for more information. You can download the solicitation document in either official language of Canada through the following link: [link to
